page.title: 09COMMUNICATIONS / MEDIA
page.content: Telecommunications provided by British Telecom via Milton Abbot and Tavistock exchanges.Main B.T. routes along A384 with underground cable with poles and overhead cables in rest of area.Most houses, being scattered have their own telephone.A public call box is provid- ed at Sydenham Damerel. The postal service is provided from Tavistock Post Office with single house delivery per day and a single collection per day from post boxes at Culverhill, Cholwill Cross and Collacombe Cross. A sub Post Office available at Sydenham Damerel (collection twice day). There are 82 actual delivery points in area. Radio and T.V. signals are received from the Caradon Radio Mast on the edge of Bodmin Moor. Media, radion, T.V. and newspapers. Latter collected from Tavistock, Milton Abbot or Hurlditch Down garage.
